revised_title: The Influence of Non-Electrolytes on Solubility: The Nature of the Processes of Dissolution and Precipitation
tldr: This study investigates the effects of non-electrolytes on the solubility of slightly soluble salts, focusing on the processes of dissolution and precipitation. The authors argue that the solubility of a salt is influenced by the presence of other salts and non-electrolytes, and that the interaction between solute and solvent is crucial in understanding these processes.
